manifest.name: 한국어
manifest.author: PeerProject Development Team
manifest.prompt: 여기를 클릭하여 자연 언어는 한국을 선택합니다.

label.tip: Seek to a position in the media file
Seek to a position in the media file
Adjust the speed of the media file

group.text: You have not downloaded any new files recently.

para.text: You have not uploaded any files.

document.name: CGeneralSettingsGroup
document.title: General
document.text: The PeerProject Settings Manager allows advanced users to completely customize how PeerProject works. The settings in the
section relate to the user experience.
Common user interface settings like tooltips, minimize behavior, number formats, prompts, etc.
Presentation, file access, and management of the file library.
Set when to use the internal PeerProject Media Center.
Your profile and direct chat settings.
IRC chatroom visual appearance and connection settings.
Integrate PeerProject with your web browser to accept peer-to-peer links and download content.

document.name: CInternetSettingsGroup
document.title: Internet
document.text: The PeerProject Settings Manager allows advanced users to completely customize how PeerProject works. The settings in the
section control how PeerProject interacts with other nodes in distributed peer-to-peer networks.
The speeds and capabilities of your Internet connection.
Download throughput, scheduling, verification, timeouts and management.
Upload capacity, queuing, banning, timeouts and special requests.
Set up the ability to control PeerProject remotely through a web browser.
Limit download connections based on a periodic schedule.

You are running the Scheduler in 'G2 only' mode. Would you like to turn this mode off, so that all active networks remain connected?

Forcing your PC into hub mode may have adverse effects on performance and the P2P network. It is generally better to allow PeerProject to decide whether or not hub mode should be used.

Hub mode does NOT produce better search results, or have any other advantages for you.

Do you really want to do this, despite these disadvantages?
Disabling support for Gnutella-1 protocols may limit your search results, and if you are acting as a hub it may also impact upon the results of other users. Are you sure you want to do this?
Gnutella2 is PeerProject's premiere network. Disabling support for it may severely limit both the number and quality of your search results. Are you SURE you want to do this?
Your outgoing bandwidth is too low to enable this network

Boosting download "%s" by removing bandwidth caps.
WARNING: Download "%s" failed verification, it may not be the file you intended to download!
Download host %s is busy, waiting in queue at position #%i of %i ("%s").
Are you sure you want to clear all paused downloads? Once a download has been cleared from the Downloads window, it cannot be resumed.

Download host's tiger-tree data is corrupt or internally inconsistent, ignoring it.

Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), busy and client does not support queues.
Push connection to %s established, waiting for handshake...
Can't open "%s" to upload to host %s, disk/file error.
Sending upload content range %I64i-%I64i from "%s" to host %s (%s).
Incoming connection from %s is a HTTP upload request.
Too busy to upload "%s" to %s, queued at #%i of %i ("%s").

Upload host %s is on the user-agent block list, denying request.
Sending upload headers from "%s" to host %s (%s).

Sending default HTML response to upload host %s (%s).

Closing upload connection %s due to lack of traffic.
Closing older upload to %s because it has made a fresh connection.
Refusing new upload to %s because an earlier connection is still pending.
Stopped uploading "%s" to %s because the file was deleted.
Sending upload content range %I64i-%I64i from partial file "%s" to host %s (%s).
Queued upload %s is re-requesting too fast, closing connection.
Refusing push request to %s because it has too many upload connections.
Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), too many concurrent from host.

Scheduling a dynamic preview of "%s" for upload to %s.

Upload connection to %s was lost, preserving queue position.
Offline queued upload host %s expired, removing.
Refusing upload of "%s" to %s (%s), all matching queues are full.
eDonkey uploads should not be cancelled. Are you sure you want to cancel this upload?
Are you sure you want to cancel/abort every download in this group?
Are you sure you want to launch the file "%s" ?\n\nSome files can be harmful to your computer. Ensure you know what the file is before launching it.
You are about to modify the metadata of %i files, are you sure you want to continue?
The file "%s" has not yet been hashed. Please wait for the file to be hashed, and then try again.

This option uses services provided by Bitzi.com for recognising and sharing information about selected files.

PeerProject will transmit the SHA1 hash code for the selected file(s) in order to query the Bitzi database. If you are concerned about privacy, you may wish to consult the Bitzi.com privacy policy.

Would you like to proceed?
Are you sure you want to permanently delete the %i selected file(s) ?\n\nThe files will be moved to your "recycle bin" if it is enabled.

You have not yet selected a media player to enqueue files with, such as Nullsoft Winamp. Would you like to select one now?\n\nPeerProject will pass the name of the file to your selected program with the "/ADD" argument.
You're not connected to the network.
Click the Connect button to get started.
The file "%s" failed a hash verification test, and might not be the file you intended to download. Are you sure you want to open it?
Would you like to remove the "potentially unsafe" attribute from this file?

Your downloaded files folder "%s" is not yet in your library.

Including your downloaded files folder in your library makes it easier to view and organise new downloads, and lets you take advantage of advanced PeerProject features such as download verification and automatic upgrading. Placing downloaded files in your library does not necessarily require you to share them: you can choose whether or not to share files independently.

Would you like to add your downloaded files folder to your library now?
Your downloads folder has been added to your library. Would you like to share it too?
Are you sure you want to delete the %i selected album folder(s) ?\n\nNote that this action does not delete the files within the album folders, only the folders themselves.

control.caption: Show a prompt before opening URIs
Switch to Transfers view on download
Hide side bar when starting search
Ask Me|Close Immediately|Minimise to Tray|Close After Transfers
Use the PeerProject Media Player to PLAY the file types listed below
Use the PeerProject Media Player to ENQUEUE the file types listed below
Warning: Choosing an external Media Handler will automatically disable all Media and Visualisation Plugins!
You can use your Gnutella User Profile to share information about yourself, your interests and recommended files and websites with others.
Enable peer to peer chat with compatible clients
Enable chat on all protocols where possible
Use PeerProject to open these types of links:
Use PeerProject to manage all my web downloads:
The download manager plugin will only attempt to download file types listed here. Other file types will be handled by your web browser. PeerProject must be running to manage downloads.
Only download and upload to networks which are connected.

PeerProject Remote Access allows you to leave PeerProject running on your PC, and control it remotely using a web browser. You will need to be able to accept incoming connections to use this feature (i.e. properly configured router, etc).

The scheduler is designed to allow you to set times when PeerProject will connect and download files. {n}{n}{n}Note: If you have PeerProject open while the scheduler is active, you may see it changing settings- This is normal.

PeerProject is a general-purpose file-sharing application that can access many P2P networks at the same time. On this page you can select which P2P networks you want to connect to, and then adjust specific settings for each network.
The Gnutella2 network is PeerProject's premiere network, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. Highly recommended.
Although the original Gnutella network is less feature-rich than Gnutella2, and has fewer files than eDonkey, it remains a valuable resource.
The eDonkey network is a popular server-based network. While not as feature-rich or fast as Gnutella2, eMule has an impressive file collection.
Search known remote servers in the server cache:
Receive and update server list from the connected server
Download eDonkey server list from the web:
Clear downloaded torrents When the share ratio reaches
Enable EndGame mode when completing torrents
If you haven't used PeerProject or another P2P client before, this QuickStart wizard can help you configure your copy in a few simple steps.
If you're a more advanced user, you can access the full range of PeerProject's options via the Tools menu. Click Exit to close the wizard at any time.
This wizard will assist you to:
Tell PeerProject about your Internet connection
Connect to your choice of P2P networks, and
For optimum performance, PeerProject needs to know a little bit about your connection to the Internet.
Choose the type of your Internet connection:
Do you want to automatically setup port-forwarding by using UPnP?
P2P networks are only as good as the people who use them. All of the content available for download is being shared by another user.
You do not have to share content to use PeerProject, however some software will behave differently to users who are not sharing anything.
Please indicate which folders, if any, you wish to share. Simply click the Add button to add a new folder.
WARNING: Distributing copyrighted works is an offence in most countries.
PeerProject is a much friendlier place when everyone writes a few basic details about themselves.
PeerProject supports a flexible user interface, so you can choose what is most comfortable for you. You can change these options at any time.
Simple, easy to use menus and buttons.{n}Familiar to users of other file sharing programs.
Power mode offers expert users lots of extra commands, windows, etc.{n}It may be a little confusing for new users!
Display simplified download progress bars. (Reduces CPU use)

PeerProject is a general-purpose file-sharing application that can access many P2P networks at the same time. Here you can select which networks you'd like to access. Note that you can always select different networks later.
The Gnutella2 network (G2) is PeerProject's premiere network, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. (Shareaza)
The original Gnutella network (G1) is less feature-rich than Gnutella2, and has fewer files than ED2K, yet remains a valuable source. (LimeWire)
The eDonkey network (ED2K) is a popular server-based network. While not as feature-rich or fast as G2, ED2K has an impressive file collection. (eMule)
PeerProject has detected that you have another eDonkey program installed on your computer. Would you like to import any unfinished downloads into PeerProject?
That's it. PeerProject has been configured to work with your computer.
If you ever need to change your settings, you can re-run this QuickStart wizard by selecting it from the Tools menu.
After closing this wizard by clicking Finish, you can connect to the networks you selected and start searching and downloading content.
Connect to the network when I close this wizard
Connect to the network every time I start PeerProject
Start PeerProject every time Windows starts
Allow others to browse my user profile
Other users browsing your profile and shared files will see your avatar. Custom avatars should be 128x128 pixels, and can be in any supported image file on your PC.
Favourite files are recommended to users who browse your profile. You can create favourite files by adding them to the "Favourites" library folder.

Users are identified by a globally unique identifier and a corresponding public and private key pair. Normally there is no need to generate a new ID, however PeerProject provides this option for advanced users.
Initiate a new connection to host or server:|Browse this host:
Downloading any file with PeerProject is easy. Simply type or paste the URL or URI describing the file into the box below and press Enter.
PeerProject can download files from the web (HTTP), and automatically search and download P2P links (Magnet, Gnutella, eDonkey, mP2P).

PeerProject can also download BitTorrent files. A torrent can be described by a .torrent file, or a HTTP link to the .torrent file. To download a torrent HTTP link, paste it in the box above. If you already have a .torrent file, click Open Torrent:
Only show matches which include the _words:
( you can also exclude words with -word )
Share this file if the parent folder is shared
Override sharing setting for this file:
Make this file available to other users

Did you know PeerProject is a 100% free product?

PeerProject does NOT contain ANY "spyware", "adware" or other bundled software. It does NOT display any advertisements or "popups", ever.{n}{n}If you ever see advertising or "popups" while using PeerProject, be assured that they are NOT coming from this program.
Unfortunately a lot of other software does come with undesirable adware or spyware, so if you see something suspicious you may wish to check your PC with an advertising or spyware removal program.

You should not have had to pay any money to obtain PeerProject. PeerProject can be freely downloaded by anyone from http://PeerProject.org/. If you paid someone money for PeerProject, you should demand a full refund immediately.
We hope you have enjoyed using PeerProject so far. We believe it is the best file sharing application around.
Unfortunately, a lot of file sharers don't know what they're missing!
If you know someone who would like PeerProject, whether they're a new user or someone still putting up with an inferior product, why not let them know there is a better alternative?
Chances are they'll be grateful you rescued them!
